intro: Rourea cassioides, commonly known as the silverleaf rourea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its dense, silver-green foliage and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite,革质 (leathery), and often have a waxy texture. Rourea cassioides is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in shady, moist environments.
